title: Data Analytics & Operations Manager, Go-To-Market (GTM) Planning & Insights
content:
At Qualtrics, we create software the worldâ€™s best brands use to deliver exceptional frontline experiences, build high-performing teams, and design products people love. But we are more than a platformâ€”we are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 18K clients globally. Building a category takes grit, determination, and a disdain
for conventionâ€”but most of all it requires close-knit, high-functioning teams with an unwavering dedication to serving our customers.When you join one of our teams, youâ€™ll be part of a nimble group thatâ€™s empowered to set aggressive goals and move fast to achieve them. Strategic risks are encouraged and complex problems are solved together, by passing the microphone and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You wonâ€™t have to look to find growth opportunitiesâ€”ready or not, theyâ€™ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, weâ€™re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 6,000 people across the globe who think thatâ€™s work worth doing.
 
 
Data Analytics & Operations Manager, Go-To-Market (GTM) Planning & Insights
 
Why we have a role: Qualtrics Go-To-Market (GTM) Planning & Insights is looking for a senior leader to build out our CDMX analyst team. The team will lead analysis, reporting, data operations, and data quality in support of a global go-to-market organization (sales, customer success, market). This role is essential to enabling our go-to-market operations and surfacing valuable insights to our field teams.  
 
Things you'll do: 
Manage the end-to-end reporting suite for global go-to-market teams (sales, customer success, marketing)
Drive analysis in support of territory planning, quota setting, pipeline and capacity health, customer health, performance management, and customer journey analytics
Lead a team of analysts handling a large volume of project and ticket-based requests for ad-hoc insights analysis, adjustments to the standard reporting suites, and data updates/maintenance in support of a global organization
Establish processes to maintain and improve data quality/accuracy/integrity of customer and operational data within Salesforce and related systems. Perform root-cause analysis of data quality issues, leading to improvements.  
Manage stakeholder relationships and understand a complex set of policies to work effectively with global field
 
How Youâ€™ll find success: 
Natural problem solver and leader; leads teams of analysts to effectively deliver on multiple priorities in a fast paced and ambiguous environment
Exemplifies ownership of projects and processes, from discovery/design phase through to implementation and ongoing management
Effectively uses data and insights to improve business performance and outcomes. 
You will know you are doing an exceptional job when our reporting suites and data operations are running smoothly, and global leaders trust you enough to come to you with their business pain points and ask for help. 
 
How youâ€™ll grow:
Opportunity to build a team from the ground up, including hiring/developing a team of analysts, creating new processes/standards from scratch
Build relationships with senior leaders and drive revenue impact across the globe 
Become a thought leader in sales and go-to-market operations, the supporting data/systems, and how data can be used to drive performance improvement. 
 
What Weâ€™re Looking For:
2+ years of experience leading and developing teams of analysts in a fast-paced environment. 
4+ years relevant industry experience in sales operations, sales planning processes, and/or associated CRM systems (i.e. salesforce.com or SAP C4C)
Project management and process improvement experience. 
Able to deal with ambiguity in a fast-paced growth environment, manage a team to strict SLAs and communicate effectively to a global audience
Experience with SQL and visual reporting tools such as Tableau, and the ability to manage a team that works day-to-day in data integration and data analysis tools. 
Degree from a top-tier university with an analytical focus (e.g. STEM, business analytics, information systems, finance, data science) 
 
What you Should Know About this Team
GTM Planning & Insights plays a critical role in managing the operating rhythm of our global go-to-market field teams, including territory planning, quota setting, pipeline and capacity health, customer health, performance management, and customer journey analytics.  If you are ready for a new high-impact challenge, we encourage you to apply.  
 
 
Our Teamâ€™s Favorite Perks and Benefits
Workspaces: We have quiet spaces to take a call or for deep thinking, and other spaces dedicated to collaboration.
Commuter Benefits: We offer a generous monthly allowance to be used for transportation and to help you commute to the office.
Wellness Reimbursement: This can be put toward wellness activities including gym memberships, spa massages, workout equipment, meditation apps, and much more.
Q Mentor Program: Looking to grow in your career? Get matched with a mentor inside Qualtrics to get meaningful coaching from someone outside your team.
 
 
Qualtrics is an equal opportunity employer meaning that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic. â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹Applicants in the United States of America have rights under Federal Employment Laws: Family & Medical Leave Act, Equal Opportunity Employment, Employee Polygraph Protection ActQualtrics is committed to the inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Qualtrics will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please let your Qualtrics contact/recruiter know.
 
Qualtrics Work Experience - As we look to the future, we believe that our teams are better together. Being together will help us learn more, grow faster and ultimately deliver better results for our customers and Qualtrics. Roles tied to an office location work 4 days per week in the office together and 1 day from home, with a strong spirit of flexibility around taking time for personal, health, and family moments in our work weeks. Our managers work with their teams to create a collaborative, engaged work environment, and arrangement that works for each of our team members.
 
Not finding a role thatâ€™s the right fit for now? Qualtrics Insiders is the one-stop shop for all things Qualtrics Life. Sign up for exclusive access to content created with you in mind and get the scoop on what we have going on at Qualtrics - upcoming events, behind the scenes stories from the team, interview tips, hot jobs, and more. No spam - we promise! You'll hear from us two times a month max with fresh, totally tailored info - so be sure to stay connected as you explore your best role and company fit.
 
 
 
 
 
 
#LI-SC11

demographic_questions.description:
DEI (Diversity, Equity and Inclusion) is a cornerstone of our company culture. With strong views on diversity and inclusion, immigration, wage equality, and the universality of human rights—without regard to race, color, creed, gender, or sexual orientation— we will not be quiet but will amplify these views on behalf of our employees and organization. 

With this in mind, we invite you to participate in the following set of voluntary demographic questions. The data collected will be used anonymously and in aggregate, so we can evaluate our processes to ensure we're providing equal opportunities to applicants from all backgrounds. Your responses, or your choice not to respond, will not be associated with your specific application and will not in any way be used for individual hiring or compensation decisions.

questions.label: How do you currently describe your gender identity?
Where have you seen Qualtrics prior to applying? Select all that apply.

values.label: I am a member of the Qualtrics Talent Community

I found Qualtrics through a third-party career site (Indeed, Glassdoor, University website, niche networking site, etc)
I have read content created by Qualtrics
I have used the Qualtrics product suite
I googled jobs and a Qualtrics role was suggested
I am a current Qualtrics employee

questions.label: Are you related to a current employee of Qualtrics? If yes, please specify name and relationship. A "relative" is defined as one of the following: spouse or significant other, parent/step parent, child/step child, grandparent, grandchild, brother, sister, uncle, aunt, nephew, niece, first cousin, in-laws (mother, father, sister, brother, daughter, son).
